qas.question: What area was known as the Slave Coast?
Who exported African slaves to the western hemisphere?
What kingdom was Guinea-Bissau once a part of?
How long did the Mali Empire persist?
Who traded slaves into the Middle East?

context: Guinea-Bissau was once part of the kingdom of <a2_0>Gabu<a2_0/>, part of the Mali Empire; parts of this kingdom persisted <a3_0>until the 18th century<a3_0/>. Other parts of the territory in the current country were considered by the Portuguese as part of their empire. <a0_0>Portuguese Guinea<a0_0/> was known as the Slave Coast, as it was a major area for the exportation of African slaves by <a1_0>Europeans<a1_0/> to the western hemisphere. Previously slaves had been traded by <a4_0>Arabs<a4_0/> north to the northern part of Africa and into the Middle East.
